Articles.Content:
Hey all,

I am using 3DS Max 2015, Photoshop 6 with Nvidia DDS plugin, and for models I have created in the past that use png or mbm textures, everything looks fine. The moment I replace the mbm texture with dds, it seems like the UV maps are in all the wrong place. I have tried using DXT 1 compression with no mipmaps and with mipmaps and het the same result. I have also tried using Paint.Net with the same result. Has anyone else run into this problem? When I get home I'll post some pictures to show what I mean.
Before you export dds, flip the texture vertically.

> 
> Before you export dds, flip the texture vertically.

Ohhhh, ok, I'll give that a shot. Thanks! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
As Porkjet stated, textures need to be flipped vertically before exporting to DDS - this is because DDS uses a different coordinate system compared to other image/texture formats.

> 
> As Porkjet stated, textures need to be flipped vertically before exporting to DDS - this is because DDS uses a different coordinate system compared to other image/texture formats.

When the image is flipped the lettering disappears in GIMP, completely. 

I wish people would strive better in this forum to give concise and complete instructions.
